result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. John Bahe Begay

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant John Bahe Begay in court with attorney Martin Jarvis.  Defendant John Bahe Begay in custody.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   State moved to dismiss and read-in.

Defendant John Bahe Begay in court by video with attorney Christopher Stephen Petros.  Defendant John Bahe Begay in custody.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Petros states Def has requested a new atty. Atty Petros states he has spoken with Public Defenders office and gave them Def's request and next court date. They are working on getting a new atty.
DEF requests to do plea today and to represent himself. Court denies request. Court grants withdrawal of Atty Petros, cases to move forward August 22nd if atty has been assigned.

Defendant John Bahe Begay in court by video with attorney Christopher Stephen Petros.  Defendant John Bahe Begay in custody.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Petros states Def has requested a new atty. Atty Petros states he has spoken with Public Defenders office and gave them Def's request and next court date. They are working on getting a new atty.
DEF requests to do plea today and to represent himself. Court denies request. Court grants withdrawal of Atty Petros, cases to move forward August 22nd if atty has been assigned.

Defendant John Bahe Begay in court with attorney Christopher Stephen Petros via phone.  Defendant John Bahe Begay in custody.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Atty Petros addressed the Court.
Plea hearing on August 7, 2017 at 03:30 pm.
Status conference on August 22, 2017 at 10:00 am.

Defendant John Bahe Begay in court.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Also has 16 CM 202, 17 CM 13, 16 CM 375, 16 CM 250, 15 CM 474, 17 CM 12 and 17 CF 18.  DE addressed the Court can not reach his attorney whom is Petros.  Atty Poquette addressed the Court.  Court rescheduled
Plea/Schedule on June 6, 2017 at 10:00 am.
Plea/Schedule on June 6, 2017 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant John Bahe Begay in court with attorney Christopher Stephen Petros.  Plea/Schedule scheduled for June 6, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant John Bahe Begay in court with attorney Christopher Stephen Petros.  Defendant John Bahe Begay in custody.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the Atty Petros acknowledge receipt of complaints in all cases set for INIT NG entered to Misd.  Atty waived time limits on preliminary exam.  Court addressed the DE as to time limits.  Court finds DE has freely waived time limits to prelim.  
  Status conference scheduled for April 4, 2017 at 10:00 am.

Defendant John Bahe Begay in court with attorney Christopher Stephen Petros.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Matter is reset.  Scheduling conference scheduled for January 31, 2017 at 10:00 am.

Defendant John Bahe Begay in court with attorney Christopher Stephen Petros.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Also has 16 CM 250, 15 CM 474,16 CM 202.  Atty Petros close to resolution.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 22, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant John Bahe Begay in court with attorney Christopher Stephen Petros via phone.  Bruce Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant advised of rights/penalties, acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading of complaint.  Also has 16CM250,15CM474 and 15 CM 466.  Court entered NG plea.   Bonds will continue.

Court: Jury trial 8/15/16 is taken off and will be rescheduled (15 Cm 466)  Status conference scheduled for October 11, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant John Bahe Begay in court, in custody.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin. DEF requests lift of no contact order on bond, victim is present,  Oakwood Haven meet with victim, State objects to modification - new charges has the current no contact  L-15-1245.    Court modifies to allow telephone contact while DEF is incarcerated
Bail/bond hearing on June 28, 2016 at 01:00 pm.  (DE's copy sent c/o Sawyer co jail)

Defendant John Bahe Begay in court.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DE does not accept the offer tendered to him by the DA.  Jury trial scheduled for August 15, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 2, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Defendant John Bahe Begay in court.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Status conference scheduled for April 26, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Defendant John Bahe Begay in court.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.     Status conference scheduled for March 15, 2016 at 10:00 am.

AMENDED - Bond - Combined with Criminal Case 15CM466 and Bond #L-15-1245 (NOTED:  $100 CBS posted in Bond L-15-1245)

Absolute Sobriety, not to consume any alcohol.

No abusive Contact with  -
 ANITA CARLEY
Statutory Minimum Domestic Abuse Bail Conditions
As a condition of my release from custody in this matter, I agree that I will not engage in any threats or acts of domestic abuse against the victim "  ANITA CARLEY  " or any other person.
I understand that "domestic abuse" means:
Intentional infliction of physical pain, injury or illness.
Intentional impairment of physical condition. 
First, second or third degree sexual assault.  
A physical act that may cause the other person reason to fear imminent engagement in the conduct described above, including but not limited to the intentional destruction of physical property.

Defendant John Bahe Begay in court, in custody, appeared by video.  Aaron B Marcoux appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant advised of rights/penalties, acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading of complaint.  DEF wishes to temporarily waive right to Attorney and speak to DA office.   Court enters NG Plea.  DEF requests bond modifications No Contact be lifted, states agrees to no abusive contact, Court addresses Ms. Carley, Court Grants bond modification. I understand that "domestic abuse" means:

First, second or third degree sexual assault.  
A physical act that may cause the other person reason to fear imminent engagement in the conduct described above, including but not limited to the intentional destruction of physical property.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 2, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Absolute sobriety, not to consume any alcohol.  No contact with Anita Carley.

DEF appears in court by video from custody.  Bruce Poquette appears for the State of WI.  
Court orders bond.  Initial appearance set for 12-15-15 @ 8:30 am.
